Detailed Description

Prints like printf to the debug pad application (MxPad).

This little class acts just like TRACE, except it prints to the Mxpad application.

Use: mxpad.printf("printf compatible string\r\n", var1, var2 ... );

Example: mxpad.printf("Hello int var=%d\r\n", var);

The header will automatically define an instance of 'mxpad'

The following defines are available to lessen typing:

P2N -- PrintF to MXPAD ... example P2N("Hello int var=%d\r\n", var);
D2N -- Dump (hexdump) to MXPAD ... example C2N(ptr, len);
C2N -- Clear MXPAD ... example C2N();

AP2N -- Asyncronous output to MXPAD ... example AP2N("Hello int var=%d\r\n", var);
A2PN print(f) to memory buffer, and output from a separate thread
Fast!

Member Function Documentation

DWORD MxPad::AnsiToUnicode ( LPCSTR  pszA,
LPWSTR *  ppszW 
)

AnsiToUnicode converts the ANSI string pszA to a Unicode string.

AnsiToUnicode returns the Unicode string through ppszW. Space for the the converted string is allocated by this function. (care: free)
Return type: DWORD

Parameters:
pszA Arg Type: LPCSTR
ppszW Arg Type: LPWSTR*

int MxPad::aprintf ( const char *  Format,
  ... 
)

Async version.

The Async version of printf. Will output to temporary buffer so it is really fast. Can be used to debug real time code, as it writes to memory, and has no IO.
It is also useful to debug constructors of global variables, as the CRT is not operational on global construct time. (go figure).

int MxPad::IsLocalAvail (  ) 

Return true if local Mxpad agent is found.

This function will test if the local agent has started. That way the app can elect to test ONCE and never to try again.
Return type: int

void MxPad::SetAppname ( const char *  str  ) 

Set Output Application Window name.

Sets the output application name as returned by FindWinow. Can be used to direct the debug output to any application that had an Edit control at its core. (NotePad for example) Make sure you know what you are doing, as it makes for a confused user seeing programming data in notepad, (seemingly) coming from nowhere.

Must call this before any other function as the found window is cached

int MxPad::SetTrace ( int  flag  ) 

Will output to TRACE instead of Mxpad.

Set Trace flag. Will output into C++ debug window instead. Returns old trace flag.

DWORD MxPad::UnicodeToAnsi ( LPWSTR  pszW,
LPSTR *  ppszA 
)

Handle/Convert UNICODE strings.

UnicodeToAnsi converts the Unicode string pszW to an ANSI string.

Returns the ANSI string through ppszA. Space for the converted string is allocated by this function. (care: free)

Return type: DWORD

Parameters:
pszW Arg Type: LPWSTR Pointer to the UNICODE str to convert from
ppszA Arg Type: LPSTR* ptr to a buffer toi receve results
